page.title: 09Churches In St.Leonard's
page.content: There are 6 churches serving the area of which 4 are Anglican,1 is R.C. and 1 is Presbyterian.St.Luke's Presbyterian Church was built by a Presbyterian Scot who was a tutor to a family.Many social activities are connected with St.Luke's.St.Leonard's Parish Church is based thematically on the sea.An interior dado of blue-grey Hornton stone topped by a wavy edge represents the sea.Other nautical features include the oak pulpit made by the shore of the Sea of Galilee.It is a replica of the prow of the boat from which Jesus taught.The lectern is made from a ship's binnacle.In the chancel's marble floor are representations of the 12 types of sea fish to be caught locally.In the floor of the sanctuary are marble patterns of loaves and fishes.
